tool.name: Convert McMicro Output to Anndata

param.label: Select the input image or images
List of markers to drop from the analysis
param.help: No quotes, separated by comma. e.g. CD3D, CD20.

param.label: Whether to Remove the DNA channels from the final output
param.help: Looks for channels with the string 'dna' in it.

param.label: Remove string from name
param.help: Used to clean up channel names. If a string is given, that particular string will be removed from all marker names. If multiple images are passed, just use the string that appears in the first image.

param.label: The number of random sampling
param.help: Randomly sub-sample the data with the desired number of cells.

param.label: Name of the column that contains the cell ID
Whether to use unique name for cells/rows
Column name to split the csv into counts table and meta data
Custom image ID
param.help: By default the name of the CSV file is used.

param.label: Minimum number of cells
param.help: If these many cells are not in the image, the image will be dropped. Particulary useful when importing multiple images.

tool.help:
**What it does**
The tool allows users to directly convert the output from [mcmicro](https://mcmicro.org/) into Anndata which is ready for downstrem analyses in `scimap` or scanpy tools.
**Return**
Anndata.
